text: is a Japanese town in Shiga Prefecture near Lake Biwa.Nussbaum, Louis- Frédéric. (2005). "Azuchi" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 64. ==History== The town is known for the ruins of Azuchi Castle. The castle was built by Oda Nobunaga in the 16th century. The castle was destroyed after Nobunaga's death by Akechi Mitsuhide in 1582; and only ruins remain. On March 21, 2010, Azuchi merged with the city of Ōmihachiman. ==Gallery== File:Azuchi Town Office.jpg|Town hall of Azuchi Image:azuchi.jpg|Stone steps at the Azuchi Castle ruins ==Related pages== * Azuchi-Momoyama period ==References== == Other websites == * Photoguide.jp Azuchi Castle Category:Towns in Japan Category:Settlements in Shiga Prefecture
